title: French type
content:
I'm aware this most likely does not exist as a digital font but could anyone point me in the direction of any similar examples. I've found a few not quite as nice examples in various Dover Books publications but none that are easily usable. Also, how would you describe typefaces of this style, is it Art Nouveau style typography?

Sorry for the poor image - I've lost the original!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019150144im_/http:/typophile.com/files/french_type_4428.jpg)
author: furryvision

comments.content: It reminds me of Kardanal DT and Tenderfoot. Not quite it, but hopefully can put you in the right path.

Minus the swashed B, [http://www.acidfonts.com/freefonts/bujardet\_freres.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019150144/http:/www.acidfonts.com/freefonts/bujardet_freres.htm "http://www.acidfonts.com/freefonts/bujardet\_freres.htm") is similar...
